bibl.title: English translation [from Spanish] of transcriptions of memorials to Clara Maass and Jesse Lazear, 1936

div1.p: These are epitaph memorials, dedicated by the Finlay Institute, to Maass and Lazear for their work in the conquest of yellow fever.

div1.head: English translation [from Spanish] of transcriptions of memorials to Clara Maass and Jesse Lazear, 1936 See Spanish original.
div1.p:
In this room was bitten (stung) experimentally by a mosquito, September 13, 1900
James William Lazear, M.D.

Acting Asst. Surgeon of the North American Army, a member of the
Commission of Yellow Fever of the Army of the U. S.A.

Dr. Lazear died a victim of this illness in the
experimental encampment at Marianao, September 28, 1900.

The Finlay Institute
dedicates this modest remembrance (token, reminder) to the memory
of this hero of Science.

Here died of Yellow Fever (experimental) August 24, 1901,
The North American Nurse

Miss Clara L. Maass
who loanedrendered her services to this hospital

The Finlay Institute
dedicates this modest remembrance to the memory of that heroine of
Science.
